channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Persistent day and night time parking at the head of the turning circle/ entrance of the park., 23rd January
item.description:
This now a regular parking spot for this vehicle. They persistently park every day and night by parking at the head of the turning circle and entrance to the park. The day before yesterday, your park operatives could not exit the park due to the blockage. This problem has been going on for a few months now. Please can parking wardens come down this street? Please can you paint yellow lines in front of the park and put up a sign? This person is not a resident of this street. They also litter when they park here.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Norfolk Close, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole, 23rd January
item.description:
There is a deep pot hole here & someone has placed a warning cone in it because it is so big. It needs urgent attention before someone has an accident.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in middle of the road, 22nd January
item.description:
This pothole has been there for over a year, on a road that is predominantly used by buses. Unfortunately this pothole presents real danger to cyclists on CS7, which is what the primary use of the road is. It is worst when the light levels are low, and is likely to cause injury to a cyclist.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44,46, Lambeth Road, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Restaurant constantly obstructing narrow pavement, 22nd January
item.description:
Deli Nene constantly obstruct the narrow pavement with their signs, barriers and chairs. Pedestrians often have to wait, or step into the road, to pass. Bromley Council have said that they do not own the pavement and cannot control this obstruction - this is not accepted. I have often asked Deli Nene to be fair to pedestrians and not obstruct the pavement but they continue. Currently, while they are renovating their premises, it is a great relief to be able to walk past unobstructed. Will you PLEASE take this opportunity to require them ALWAYS to LEAVE AT LEAST 50% OF THE PAVEMENT UNOBSTRUCTED for the use and passage of pedestrians. Their neighbours, Fee and Brown, do NOT obstruct the narrow pavement so please require Deli Nene not to exceed Fee & Brown's practice. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Someone dumper two cookers outside my gate, 22nd January
item.description:
Went a outside to places my recycling bins out for tomorrows collection and next to the lamppost in front of the property next to the garden gate someone has dumped two old cookers (look to be electric cookers) unsure if they are placed there for a specific collection of some sort but they are not from my property or from number 1 station estates property. We have not placed them there and they are blocking the pathway for anyone using buggies or with small children.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Estate, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Uneven, broken paving slabs outside 40 St Johns Road Sidcup DA14 4HH, 22nd January
item.description:
